verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when all the kings which were on this side Jordan, in the hills, and in the valleys, and in all the coasts of the great sea over against Lebanon, the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard thereof;
verses.ct: When all the kings west of the Jordan heard about what had happened — those in the hill country, the lowlands, and all along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea up toward Lebanon — the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites —

verses.kjv: That they gathered themselves together, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
verses.ct: they formed a united alliance to fight against Joshua and Israel.

verses.kjv: And when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done unto Jericho and to Ai,
verses.ct: But when the people of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,

verses.kjv: They did work wilily, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and wine bottles, old, and rent, and bound up;
verses.ct: they came up with a cunning plan. They disguised themselves as travelers from a distant land, loading their donkeys with worn-out sacks and old wineskins that were cracked and patched together.

verses.kjv: And old shoes and clouted upon their feet, and old garments upon them; and all the bread of their provision was dry and mouldy.
verses.ct: They put worn-out, repaired sandals on their feet and dressed in ragged clothing. All the bread they brought was dry and covered in mold.

verses.kjv: And they went to Joshua unto the camp at Gilgal, and said unto him, and to the men of Israel, We be come from a far country: now therefore make ye a league with us.
verses.ct: They went to Joshua at the camp in Gilgal and said to him and the men of Israel, "We've traveled here from a distant country. Please make a treaty with us."

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel said unto the Hivites, Peradventure ye dwell among us; and how shall we make a league with you?
verses.ct: The men of Israel said to the Hivites, "Maybe you actually live nearby. How can we make a treaty with you?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto Joshua, We are thy servants. And Joshua said unto them, Who are ye? and from whence come ye?
verses.ct: They told Joshua, "We are your servants." Joshua asked them, "Who are you? Where do you come from?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, From a very far country thy servants are come because of the name of the LORD thy God: for we have heard the fame of him, and all that he did in Egypt,
verses.ct: They answered, "Your servants have come from a very distant country because of the reputation of the LORD your God. We've heard about his fame and everything he did in Egypt,

verses.kjv: And all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites, that were beyond Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon, and to Og king of Bashan, which was at Ashtaroth.
verses.ct: and everything he did to the 2 Amorite kings east of the Jordan — Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth.

verses.kjv: Wherefore our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spake to us, saying, Take victuals with you for the journey, and go to meet them, and say unto them, We are your servants: therefore now make ye a league with us.
verses.ct: So our elders and everyone in our country told us, 'Pack food for the journey, go meet them, and tell them: We are your servants. Please make a treaty with us.'

verses.kjv: This our bread we took hot for our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go unto you; but now, behold, it is dry, and it is mouldy:
verses.ct: Look at this bread — it was still warm from the oven when we packed it the day we left to come to you. But now see how dry and moldy it is.

verses.kjv: And these bottles of wine, which we filled, were new; and, behold, they be rent: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.
verses.ct: These wineskins were brand new when we filled them, but look — they're split open now. And our clothes and sandals have fallen apart from the extremely long journey."

verses.kjv: And the men took of their victuals, and asked not counsel at the mouth of the LORD.
verses.ct: The Israelite leaders sampled some of their food but did not consult the LORD about the decision.

verses.kjv: And Joshua made peace with them, and made a league with them, to let them live: and the princes of the congregation sware unto them.
verses.ct: Joshua made peace with them and established a treaty guaranteeing their safety, and the leaders of the community swore an oath to honor it.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a league with them, that they heard that they were their neighbours, and that they dwelt among them.
verses.ct: 3 days after making the treaty, the Israelites discovered that these people were actually their neighbors, living right among them.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel journeyed, and came unto their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, and Chephirah, and Beeroth, and Kirjathjearim.
verses.ct: The Israelites set out and reached their cities on the 3rd day. Their cities were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kirjathjearim.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the congregation had sworn unto them by the LORD God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against the princes.
verses.ct: But the Israelites did not attack them, because the leaders of the community had sworn an oath to them by the LORD God of Israel. The whole community grumbled against the leaders.

verses.kjv: But all the princes said unto all the congregation, We have sworn unto them by the LORD God of Israel: now therefore we may not touch them.
verses.ct: But all the leaders told the community, "We swore an oath to them by the LORD God of Israel. We cannot lay a hand on them now.

verses.kjv: This we will do to them; we will even let them live, lest wrath be upon us, because of the oath which we sware unto them.
verses.ct: Here is what we'll do with them: we'll let them live, so that God's anger doesn't fall on us for breaking the oath we swore to them."

verses.kjv: And the princes said unto them, Let them live; but let them be hewers of wood and drawers of water unto all the congregation; as the princes had promised them.
verses.ct: The leaders continued, "Let them live, but assign them to cut wood and carry water for the entire community." This is what the leaders had promised them.

verses.kjv: And Joshua called for them, and he spake unto them, saying, Wherefore have ye beguiled us, saying, We are very far from you; when ye dwell among us?
verses.ct: Joshua summoned the Gibeonites and confronted them: "Why did you deceive us by claiming, 'We live very far from you,' when you actually live right here among us?

verses.kjv: Now therefore ye are cursed, and there shall none of you be freed from being bondmen, and hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.
verses.ct: From now on you are under a curse. You will never stop serving as slaves — cutting wood and carrying water for the house of my God."

verses.kjv: And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how that the LORD thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you, therefore we were sore afraid of our lives because of you, and have done this thing.
verses.ct: They replied to Joshua, "Your servants were clearly told that the LORD your God commanded his servant Moses to give you this entire land and to wipe out all its inhabitants ahead of you. We were terrified for our lives because of you, so we did this.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, we are in thine hand: as it seemeth good and right unto thee to do unto us, do.
verses.ct: Now we are in your hands. Do whatever you think is right and fair."

verses.kjv: And so did he unto them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they slew them not.
verses.ct: So Joshua dealt with them accordingly — he protected them from the Israelites so they were not killed.

verses.kjv: And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation, and for the altar of the LORD, even unto this day, in the place which he should choose.
verses.ct: That day Joshua assigned them to cut wood and carry water for the community and for the altar of the LORD, at whatever place he would choose. They continue in that role to this day.
